cwe_description: The product reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or execution of arbitrary code.
explanation: The code iterates through bin->ne_header->SegCount to access bin->segment_entries[i]. If SegCount is controlled by an untrusted input (e.g., from a malformed file header) and is larger than the actual allocated size of bin->segment_entries, an out-of-bounds read will occur when accessing bin->segment_entries[i]. This can lead to information disclosure, denial of service, or potentially arbitrary code execution depending on the memory layout and subsequent use of the read data.

cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or other undefined behavior.
explanation: The code iterates using `bin->ne_header->SegCount` which is read from an untrusted NE binary header. If an attacker provides a malicious NE file where `SegCount` is larger than the actual allocated size of `bin->segment_entries`, an out-of-bounds read will occur when accessing `bin->segment_entries[i]`. This can lead to information disclosure, denial of service, or potentially arbitrary code execution.
